body:
*bump*

related: `mlflow ui` does not allow the user to specify an IP to bind to (like `jupyter` does) but instead hard-codes 127.0.0.1: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/69fabbcf59b690f021bf047c0bf3e2de594c70e6/mlflow/cli.py#L198

also, it's confusing to have two entrypoints to the UI?  are we supposed to use `mlflow ui` or `mlflow server`?  

I was able to get `mlflow server --host $MY_IP` to work the same way as `jupyter` does.  But `mlflow ui` binds to an IP that doesn't work.

FWIW I am running `mlflow` in a docker container on a remote machine.  Also Tensorboard always binds to a useable IP (or maybe it just listens on all interfaces).  Not sure why Tensorboard does the right thing while `mlflow` and `jupyter` need configuration.

I would propose fixing / deprecating the `mlflow ui` entrypoint.
